website_summaries.verdict: A comfortable hiking boot for all conditions.
pros: Comfortable and fit for a variety of conditions
Charcoal bamboo insulation keeps feet warm, but the boots are still breathable
We love the combination of waterproof leather uppers and ventilation
cons: Thick insulation can cause feet to slip in boot, and these may be too warm for summer hiking

customer_reviews.title: Try before you buy
customer_reviews.text: I've owned several pairs of KEEN "work" boots and the toe box is much wider. I assumed that this was a normal fit; however, the hiking boots are smaller in the toe box. I've been wearing them everyday hoping that they will stretch a bit wider, but no luck. My toes feel packed so order wide and possibly go a half to full size larger. Overall they are a good looking boot, but as I stated in the headline: Try before you buy. Safety toed work boots are very much different than hiking boots.
customer_reviews.author: Skipper 6.0

customer_reviews.title: I really like that Keen made this boot slightly wider than my ...
customer_reviews.text: This boot is very well suited for cold weather hiking.... insulated to keep your feet warm down to -20 degrees! I really like that Keen made this boot slightly wider than my other cold weather boots like the Vasque Snowblime. The little extra width adds all day comfort and, if needed, room for heavier socks to endure colder weather. Another feature I like is the two different compounds in the rubber soles. It gives the boot a flexible feel on different terrain and cushions your step. It also displaces mud and dirt easier because of this.... what another writer calls "squishy", I call an advantage! I find myself wearing this boot all the time regardless of outdoor temperature.
customer_reviews.author: Zillbilly

customer_reviews.title: I have worn these boots inside and outsidr the house for over a week and am VERY pleased with their warmth and comfort
customer_reviews.text: My "old" Keen boots had worn out and I did a lot of research prior to this purchase to make sure this boot would fill my needs. I am 80 years old and needed a waterproof, insulated boot for when i'm snow blowing a large driveway. I have worn these boots inside and outsidr the house for over a week and am VERY pleased with their warmth and comfort. My feet do not overheat inside the house and sray plenty warm outside (temp. below 30F in northern NH). Thank you so much for continuing to produce a quality product at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Howard West

customer_reviews.title: Strong and durable boots.
customer_reviews.text: I own several pairs of Keen shoes and boots. Quality has come down some in the last year. The wellington boots and hiking boots still out last competitive boots by 50 to 80 percent. Leather strong not as clear from blemishes, it's a details thing. If you have wide feet this boot could change your life.
customer_reviews.author: Craig McEwen

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, sturdy boots, but they aren't waterproof as advertised...
customer_reviews.text: I wore these boots for the first time today. I work at a body shop and spend a lot of time on my feet and washing cars. The boots kept my feet dry for the most part, but at the end of the day the inside lining was obviously moist from water soaking into the boot. This is kind of disappointing since I bought them for the waterproof feature. To be clear no water came in from the lip of the boots. Water was mostly absorbed into the top face and toe of the boots.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Hixon

customer_reviews.title: NOT DISAPPOINTED
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, great fit for wider feet, and affordable on sale. I tried boots at REI, Dicks Sporting Good, and several from Amazon (Merrell, Dr. Martens, Sorel, Timberland) and was disappointed repeatedly. I have purchased Keen before and had trouble with the soles shredding apart. But I thought I'd try them again. NOT DISAPPOINTED. I'm planning on buying another pair to keep in reserve in case the manufacturer decides to "improve" the boot by cutting their costs in quality/comfort. The moment I tried this boot on I knew it was a winner.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonNSAend of privacy

customer_reviews.title: Best boots ever, and $64 cheaper than retail
customer_reviews.text: Are usually take a 12 4E But these boots fit like a glove, so comfortable, so much support, the foot bed is so cushiony and bouncy and I love the real rubber soul not cheap hard plastic. I have never owned a pair of keen before but this will not be my last pair for I will purchase my summer footwear with this company as well. I look forward to testing these in my harsh mean winter conditions for 2018
customer_reviews.author: Roger B.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for warm toes and feet in Michigan!
customer_reviews.text: These boots are fantastic. I need a wide toe box and room to move my feet around just a tad in a boot. I wear a cotton liner sock with a medium to thick wool sock (like Smartwool). As I have Raynauds, I can’t afford to have any constriction in my feet. I wear a women’s size 9 in a boot, and tried the men’s 7 and 7.5 in the boot. I preferred the 7.5. The 200 insulation is perfect. The boot looks nice as well. Two thumbs up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 5 feels great! I would recommend to brake them in
customer_reviews.text: Dude... I just found my new boots. If I could live inside them I would. I wear a size 12-12.5 just depends on the shoes. But the 11.5 feels great! I would recommend to brake them in. Not that they will leave blisters. It just feels like the heels are tall and your feet slide forward. So about 30 hours of brake in time will fix that.
customer_reviews.author: YesStuffYea

customer_reviews.title: Great boots!
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome boots. I bought them for winter hiking as they are warm and waterproof, but they quickly became my all-purpose boot for winter. I now wear these for hiking as well as shoveling the snow and I love them. They are never too hot, which is surprising for me because my feet sweat easily. I ordered the brown color and they look great with jeans as well as on the trail. Also, I read the reviews and ordered a half size smaller and I'm glad I did. The half size smaller fits perfect, and the wide format of Keen boots allows my toes to still have more than enough room.
customer_reviews.author: Cecily & Ben

customer_reviews.title: KEEN, GREAT SHOES
customer_reviews.text: Feels like it's a little big, but I thinks it's because of the large toe box. Which is fine for extra room to layer socks when it's frigid out. I needed something insulated and wasn't sure the 200g Keen warm would be enough, but it's perfect! A little warm for 40 degrees+ and perfect for 25-30 degrees, assuming your moving from time to time and not just sitting in a tree stand or what have you. The boot design allows for ample room for thick or layered socks for extra warmth, so I wouldn't get a larger size if your considering it. 5th pair of Keens and still love them all!
customer_reviews.author: Colby L.

customer_reviews.title: Great Keen boot as expected
customer_reviews.text: I love the two other pair of Keens I own so I had high expectations for these as well. The Revel III has not disappointed. They fit just as I expected and have worn them all day at work for a couple of days now with no issues. I have not had to deal with any cold weather yet so I can't say how they will perform in this area. Also, a big reason I bought Keen's was there lifetime replacement policy (which I have used and they have followed thru on 100%). With that peace of mind, how do you not buy Keen's.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: been very happy with all of them
customer_reviews.text: I have many pairs of Keen shoes, been very happy with all of them. Can't say the same with these. Received them late and boots were flawed, there's an unsealed gap approximately 2 cm in length between the leather upper and the sole on the right shoe. These boots were much anticipated and I feel quite let down upon receiving them. This is a quality control issue and should be picked up well before shipping. Not happy. Just an update. Had the boots for about a month. Both laces broke. Minimal use.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Sweeney

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfortable Boot!
customer_reviews.text: I love Keens! I purchased these boots in size 13. I took them to Chicago on Black Friday and was out all day in them and my feet were comfortable. They appear to be well-constructed, several of the 12 guys I was with gave positive comments on them and asked where I purchased them. It was in the 40's (temperature) so not a cold day. I don't know how warm they will be when it is in the 20's. Time will tell. But I really like these boots!
customer_reviews.author: TCRay

customer_reviews.title: Great boot. Sized slightly small in length.
customer_reviews.text: I've walked about 60 miles so far and they felt great from the get go. I was a bit concerned about fitting and at first thought they might be a little too short for my feet, but have had no issues with toe bruising or any blistering. I bought them for snow hiking and fall backpacking. I haven't had a chance to try them in those conditions yet, but have walked in 25o F weather for about an hour and my feet were toasty warm. For someone with as bad of circulation as me that was quite nice. They seem sturdy and I can't wait to put them through some more rigorous testing in the Cascades.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine

customer_reviews.title: It is a winter boot
customer_reviews.text: It fits more than a winter boot than a hiking boot. The sole it quite soft, the boot is light and the fit is large. But the fit is OK when I wear a thick sock. They are quite warm, I won't use them over 40°F , 5 °C. On a trail I think I could go a low as -25 °C, in snow I would not go below - 20°C. I walked in wet snow for 2 hours and they were still dry. There is a small metal ring on the boot that attract snow like a magnet. I think I will cut it off.
customer_reviews.author: Bertrand Pigeon

customer_reviews.title: This boot hit it spot on, 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: Would like to thank Amazon's return policy as it was hard for me to find a pair of good fitting boots. This one is great, super comfortable, warm, traction is good in snow. This was what I was looking for. Recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: JAMES

customer_reviews.title: keen hiking boot
customer_reviews.text: great KEEN hiking boot for outdoor work, insulated, water proof, leather upper , comfortable out of the box I wear a 10 D , got a 10.5 based on other comments, good move , requires a winter sock to get a good fit . and right now .. amason hot pricing.. makes this a sweet deal
customer_reviews.author: Tom Mc- Dad

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and durable. There was virtually no break in period for this boot. I also like the width (runs wider than most brands) of the toe box which is a signature trait of Keen boots. As with most reviews on recently purchased products, time will tell if these hold up but if they are like other Keen products that I own, there should be no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Make good products and stay in business

customer_reviews.title: he says they fit good since he typically wears an 11
customer_reviews.text: Considering what others said in past reviews, I ordered 1/2 size up. Because of that, he says they fit good since he typically wears an 11. Too early to tell how they wear overall, since he just started wearing them, but very comfortable so far. He stated that he really liked that they had a wool lined foot bed rather than nylon type. Seems to help keep feet secure and dry. Hope this helps
customer_reviews.author: Terina O'Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Feel great, but v-lock and laces make them hard to get on and off
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about these boots except the laces. I replaced them with Lock Laces and they are now the perfect boot for me. The color is more charcoal than green. They are nice looking and feel great. They are truly waterproof and better on snow and ice than most Keens I have had.
customer_reviews.author: M Summers

customer_reviews.title: feet felt great after walking all day on the hard cobblestones in Paris..
customer_reviews.text: at first I thought they'd be too big (about 1/4 size too big? but with good hiking socks and properly lacing them up, awesome boot. while they haven't hit the trail yet, I wore them 12 hrs @ day, everyday while 'hiking' Paris in December.... feet felt great after walking all day on the hard cobblestones in Paris..
customer_reviews.author: Just Bill

customer_reviews.title: Good enough to kick around a snowy yard with but ...
customer_reviews.text: Good enough to kick around a snowy yard with but I sure wouldn’t hike in these. There’s no support and a longer hike would murder my feet. Comfy and warm enough but not up to the job of traversing mountains in cold snowy weather
customer_reviews.author: Airdchartdan

customer_reviews.title: Great Hiking Boots!
customer_reviews.text: Great hiking boots! Took them on a hard, overnight hiking trip. It rained and we walked through multiple streams. Never once had wet socks! I love this brand and will buy more of these when I wear these ones out. They are a little on the heavy-side, but you can't beat the quality of these boots! A++
customer_reviews.author: Eugene

customer_reviews.title: Love my Keen's!
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots and have several pairs of Keen shoes. I love their sandals and have 3 pairs of their boots and all wear good and are very comfortable. These are insulated and very warm in the winter, a little bit too hot for summer wear but could be if needed. I would recommend these to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Frankie

customer_reviews.title: Very good hiking boots!
customer_reviews.text: Good boots. I bought them without much time for break in before a hiking trip. Hiked about 70 miles in them over a week. They were great. Comfy, supportive, and waterproof when hiking through some sloppy snow and mud. Weak point was the laces, but really that's minor. Color wasn't quite what I expected. I ordered the olive color, but they are pretty much black. Very very dark. Good boots though. I've never worn keens before, but really like these. Woild definitely order again.
customer_reviews.author: The dude.

customer_reviews.title: Durable and comfortable, but be prepared to invest in shoe ties
customer_reviews.text: Its a great shoe and very comfortable. I would give it 5 star rating if there wasn't for the shoe tie problem. Those metal threads wear and break shoe ties very quickly. Be prepared to change shoe tie every 10 days. I only use these shoes when I'm out on a hike or go to the mountains and I already went trough 6-7 shoe ties.
customer_reviews.author: dreamerns

customer_reviews.title: Unhappy customer
customer_reviews.text: I like them until the seam blew out within a couple months. I got a hold of the manufacturer they said to send them back which I did. they said they approved it for a refund, about a month later I received my old boots back in the mail and now they will not talk to me.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Best boots
customer_reviews.text: I love the revel III the most comfortable boots ever. I need to wear boots for my work and these are the only ones does not give me any trouble. I am wearing them almost 9 hours a day and do not feel them on my foot. These are my second pair since my first pair is worn out after 3 years of continuous wear. I recommend it to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Ali Levent Kilic

customer_reviews.title: Happy Feet!
customer_reviews.text: First pair of Keens for me and I couldn't be happier! Great fit & comfort on the very first hike. Love the wide toe box and the taper back to the heel. "Wide" fit shoes are too wide @ the heel for me & my foot slops around in them. These boots fit my entire foot for excellent support and comfort. Received them during the recent cold snap and the 200g insulation was just the ticket in 20° weather.
customer_reviews.author: The Muellers

customer_reviews.title: shreds laces like you wouldn't believe
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing Keens for almost 20 years and have loved every pair. It was time for a new winter/hiking boot so I hooked up with these. I know this sounds bizarre but the first set of laces went within 2 weeks. Bought replacement ones and a month later same thing. It seems that the edges of the eyelets are little razors that shred the laces every time you tighten them. Have tried to "file" the edges but to no avail. About to go get my 4th set of laces. Sounds petty but this is REALLY annoying. Other than that the shoes are fantastic
customer_reviews.author: jonathon gillespie

customer_reviews.title: I own other pairs of keens, but this was ...
customer_reviews.text: I own other pairs of keens, but this was the first time I've ordered them from amazon the boots fell apart less than a month. I'm blaming amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Jk McGuffey

customer_reviews.title: Limited use failure
customer_reviews.text: I bought these keen boots 1.5years ago. I wore them approximate 35 times, reserving them for inclement weather. Recently the side of the boot gave way for no apparent reason. I asked keen for a return, but they declined saying it was out of date for the warranty. Things to watch: The tag, Keen basses its warranty on wears off after limited use. If the tag is worn out it adds to keens tools to deny their boot is faulty. Snap a picture of the tag the day you receive the keen article. You get one year of use, witch is fare, unless you don't use the boot that often. Then a failure is on you.
customer_reviews.author: Karl

customer_reviews.title: Good footwear
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for rugged and comfort wear. They are very nice fitting with wider toe. I got a lot of compliments on looks too. One thing is I never had issue with foot odor then after one year it bad. Found the inner soul had fungus growing so be sure to remove liner and let dry after hard day. I’ll buy another pair.
customer_reviews.author: Tazz mania

customer_reviews.title: Great boots!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I read a lot of reviews about getting a half size up. I usually wear a 12 and did not want to go to a 13 so I ordered 12. The fit great. Perhaps because of the larger toe box compared to other shoes. Very comfortable. I've hiked in the snow and wear them to work in the snow, slush, and rain, and my feet have remained dry.
customer_reviews.author: dadw2girls

customer_reviews.title: Spot on
customer_reviews.text: By the previous reviews, I hoped they'd have the wide toe box, and that's exactly what I got. Roomy for a canoe shaped, wide foot, like myself. I'll use a low arch insert, but they fit great with the factory insole too. My first pair of Keen, but definitely not my last.
customer_reviews.author: Tcharney

customer_reviews.title: Keen, a good quality boot.
customer_reviews.text: These are tough boots that are comfortable. I purchase Keen all the time because they are quality and always last. The bootlaces could be thicker or tougher, but I am very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Durkin

customer_reviews.title: Great Boot for cold weather  work
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these to take on cold testing trips for vehicle calibration and to wear when plowing my driveway with my tractor. Feet stay warm and dry! Was in a cold box set to -25C for 35 min and feet stayed warm! Nice and light weight, comfortable right out of the box. Toe box is a bit wider than a normal shoe. Keen's did not disappoint
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey Grossman

customer_reviews.title: Awesome boots - lightweight and comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots! I wear a size 14, and have trouble finding boots that aren't too wide for my feet. These are light, and so comfortable. High quality construction, and good looking too! Ready to go right out of the box!
customer_reviews.author: jesmo5

customer_reviews.title: Durable and comfortable boots
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband. And he absolutely loves them. This is his second pair. They are durable boots. And he always comments on the comfort and support they provide. I would recommend these boots
customer_reviews.author: Angela Clark

customer_reviews.title: Finially a leather hiking boot
customer_reviews.text: I like Keen but more and more available boots are made with non leather materials, this boot was not available in my size in stores so found it on Amazon. I really love these boots.
customer_reviews.author: pete

customer_reviews.title: Nice all-round boot for northern climates
customer_reviews.text: Been wearing Keen boots for a number of years, just starting on my 4th pair now. Very comfortable and the "my" size always fits. Great for work, hiking and pretty much, everyday use. I don't hesitate to put them on in rain or snow. I also find them very durable, have 2 pairs on the go, an "older" and a "newer" pair. When the older pair wears out, I pick a style/colour, order, and I'm good for another 4 or 5 years. I recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: These shoes are probably one of the most comfortably boots I've every worn
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are probably one of the most comfortably boots I've every worn. I have not tested out on a trail yet, but have worn them for everyday use to test the comfort and breaking them in. Honestly, you do not have to break them in... They look great, the material is quality. So far I really like them...
customer_reviews.author: Walt

customer_reviews.title: A little bigger than expected, weak shoe laces
customer_reviews.text: These should almost be labeled as wide. 3rd pair of Keens.. Might be my last. UPDATE: Bought these a few months ago, and fabric covering the laces has already broken. I have not been happy with this purchase. What a waste of money. I am so disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Zuber

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product.
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic. Great fit. Very comfortable. Just got done sled riding for about 6 hrs and didn’t even think about how dry and toasty my feet were. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Great boots.
customer_reviews.text: These are great boots. They are light weight and comfortable after miles.
customer_reviews.author: J Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Such a comfortable boot. Like running sneakers but very supportive. Warm too for working outside in cold VT winters
customer_reviews.author: Kelley H.

customer_reviews.title: Light weight hikers
customer_reviews.text: Keen is a great brand!! I have a few pairs and love them all.. bought these because I wanted a lighter weight hiking boot. These are great boots
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Be prepared to replace the laces immediately
customer_reviews.text: They promise to be sturdy boots, but they're slightly larger than I expected them to be. The biggest issue is that the metal eyelets are too sturdy for the laces; after only a week of wearing them, the eyelets ripped the skin off one of the laces.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Glass

customer_reviews.title: Great out of the box!
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves them, there comfortable from the get go,hold up really well, and last for a couple of years.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan.
customer_reviews.text: Did my research on Keen boots. Was looking for something reasonably priced. Was under the impression that they were really good boots. However they fell apart in less than a year of having them. Contacted Keen, they gave me a credit which I used on some of there other products which I also found a lack of quality. I'll be going back to Lowas and spend the extra money on a good quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Pollert

customer_reviews.title: Great Boot, hardly need any breaking in!
customer_reviews.text: These are the best feeling boots I've ever purchased! Toe box is great, especially if you wear thick Sox, or ever need to. I have a new favorite boot now. These Keens are Great!
customer_reviews.author: Greg Naatz

customer_reviews.title: Great winter boots!
customer_reviews.text: Love these boots. Keep my feet warm while working. Seem to breathe ok, but start to feel a little clammy by the end of the day (typical with Gore-tex type shoes for me). Work great for hiking in the snow, traction is good with softer rubber soles. I really like the dark leather, they look great. Had to replace the insole though, the ones that come with have very little support.
customer_reviews.author: Railings pro

customer_reviews.title: Through experience have found that European size 41 is best for me
customer_reviews.text: I am a woman with EE wide feet. Through experience have found that European size 41 is best for me. The Keen Men's Revel III winter boot is wider than woman's version and fits very well. Allows room for both midweight and heavyweight socks. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Traveler

customer_reviews.title: great hiking boot
customer_reviews.text: great walking boot, good traction, good fit, cant wait to try snowshoeing with them!
customer_reviews.author: chaindrivecharlie

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and durable for a long time
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing Keen boots for several years now. Once you find the boot that fits your foot the best I think you will also wear them for years. I’m on my feet all day doing lawn fertilizing and other landscaping jobs. My feet are comfortable all day period.
customer_reviews.author: Adam L.

customer_reviews.title: Proper sizing
customer_reviews.text: I'm currently in Antarctica and these boots work great for knockaround day hikers. Very comfortable and warm.
customer_reviews.author: Brtcaptain

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome. Even better when the seller delivers s perfect product.
customer_reviews.author: drjbling

customer_reviews.title: Good winter boot with minor faults
customer_reviews.text: This is a good boot if you live in the snow & ice belt. After 4 months of daily use I've had to replace the laces and insoles. The insoles were sliding backwards under foot, had to replace with aftermarket insoles.
customer_reviews.author: Cabin Fever

customer_reviews.title: Keen quality as expected!
customer_reviews.text: Keen quality always amazes me. You can wear the shoes for 3 years and beat them to death and they still look like new. These are no different.
customer_reviews.author: WB

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my boyfriend for xmas. He loves them and they fit as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah S.

customer_reviews.title: Good Boot
customer_reviews.text: Order 1⁄2 size up, as others have said. Not great support, but adequate, I use inserts anyway. Nice boot.
customer_reviews.author: Ludlow

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfectly and is just as advertised. Looks great and very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best shoe, boots, ever made !!
customer_reviews.text: I only buy keen I actually bought these for my son he loves them and is a keen costumer for life he says they are great comfortable and can walk in them for days
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable boots
customer_reviews.text: Second pair just as comfortable as the first. I'm a big guy so I wear through them pretty fast but they lasted me 8 months. I wear them for work and usually get about 3 months out my boots. Will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: ttwilber

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Great winter boot! Keen has always been a quality product! Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: jcis31

customer_reviews.title: Fall apart
customer_reviews.text: Within a week toe was falling apart. Comfortable out of the box but did not last.
customer_reviews.author: Scott H.

customer_reviews.title: Tuff
customer_reviews.text: I've had many pairs of keens. They are the best. Whether I'm hunting..hiking.. or whatever. They hold up.
customer_reviews.author: dan l.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Nice boot. I owned 2 pairs of the Keen Clevelander boots before. Those boots were 100% leather. These boots have a nylon tongue and upper. Much lighter then my past pairs. Very comfortable right out of the box. If you are between sizes order the larger size.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Look at item before shipping!
customer_reviews.text: WRONG COLOR!!! Clearly black, not tawny olive!! Now I get to see the disappointed look on husbands face at Christmas, send them back, and husband has no boots till then..terrible!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent boots!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent boots!! Extremely comfortable and have the feel of quality. Either I overlooked the fact that they were a winter boot or the description wasn't clear, but since I live in Florida they're just too warm for the climate here. But if you live up north you won't go wrong with these boots!! 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Run small.
customer_reviews.text: I wear a size 14 in most brands (Merrell, ASICS, etc.), but a 14 was far too small. Had to return them. I'm not willing to pay $50 more for a size 15.
customer_reviews.author: Mark S.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable and build like a TANK. Waterproof as listed and does fit true to size.
customer_reviews.author: 14therd

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great boot for winter months. Waterproof and warm. Too warm for summer wear if you'd ask me.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer Eley

customer_reviews.title: Cold Weather Hiking boots
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable right out of the box! They look as great as they feel! My son liked them so much, I ordered another pair for him!
customer_reviews.author: David Figge

customer_reviews.title: Ok but not worth 150
customer_reviews.text: Being used as an everyday work boot. I dont like that its starting to show wear at the edges ( glue becoming undone).
customer_reviews.author: Curtis

customer_reviews.title: A very good lightweight hiking boot
customer_reviews.text: A very good lightweight hiking boot. I wore the 1st pair out of the box into a 6 day bush walk in Tasmania that involved mostly off track walking and a 12 hour scrub bashing session. The boots stood up the wear and tear and feet were good for a change at the end of a solid wander.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My new favorite boots. Very comfortable, warm, waterproof, and good looking. What more could you ask for?
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Eckert

customer_reviews.title: Keen products have not let me down.
customer_reviews.text: Knew that I would be getting quality with Keen, and not disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: pete_009

customer_reviews.title: ... little nervous about sizing but knew the brand was good. They were delivered quickly
customer_reviews.text: Never purchased boots online and was a little nervous about sizing but knew the brand was good. They were delivered quickly, fit perfectly and are some of the most comfortable boots I have ever bought - wear them every day and love them!
customer_reviews.author: Amy Hopper

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent boots and very comfortable! With heavy wool socks, they will be snug.
customer_reviews.author: Maximum Ordinate

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Toe box seemed tight & pressure from top-down. Couldn't wear.
customer_reviews.author: Bru-sky

customer_reviews.title: love this boot by Keen
customer_reviews.text: great comfortable walking to do everything boot support and balance, protect from weather, rain to snow
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth. Walters

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: 4th pair of Keen boots - always a good fit and a sturdy product
customer_reviews.author: Alex Schyljuk

customer_reviews.title: Top quality! Bought my pair in the fall and ...
customer_reviews.text: Top quality! Bought my pair in the fall and now that we are in winter up in New England, I'm putting them through the paces and they are performing just as expected. Dry. Grippy. Well made product.
customer_reviews.author: Redmoon

customer_reviews.title: The color goes well with anything
customer_reviews.text: My husband received these as a Christmas gift and absolutely loves them! He has worn a pair prior to these that were also Keens and loved those as well. Definitely recommend as he is a picky shoe shopper.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyna

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof  comfortable and outlast any boots he has ever had
customer_reviews.text: I got them for my dad he absolutely loves them he says this is only brand he will wear from now on
customer_reviews.author: Diane Furman

customer_reviews.title: The shoe lace bracket at the top sheared off the ...
customer_reviews.text: The shoe lace bracket at the top sheared off the boot after only the first use. I expected more from a Keen boot.
customer_reviews.author: Helpful

customer_reviews.title: Excellent. The only thing is they come with somewhat ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. The only thing is they come with somewhat flat insouls, different than the standard in Keen Voyager. I swapped them from my other shoes.
customer_reviews.author: PP

customer_reviews.title: Toe box has good room
customer_reviews.text: The sole has a fiber material. There is no removable insole. I use an orthotic in my shoes so not a big deal but, I like the extra cushion in the forefoot.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel M.

customer_reviews.title: A Great Boot
customer_reviews.text: This is probably best boot I've ever had. It is comfortable and holds up well. My second pair!
customer_reviews.author: Mick McLeno

customer_reviews.title: Great boots. I have several pairs of Keen boots
customer_reviews.text: Great boots. I have several pairs of Keen boots. These are exceptional. I wish they would make a non insulated version for summer.
customer_reviews.author: Chris R.

customer_reviews.title: All day comfort from the get go.
customer_reviews.text: These run a little small so I had to return the first pair and order a half size up from what I normally wear.
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and worth the cost
customer_reviews.text: Nice boot. Fits perfectly. This is my 3rd pair and they are very rugged and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: DamonLehr

customer_reviews.title: Nice boots
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the box great fit no breaking in extremely satisfied
customer_reviews.author: Mule Man

customer_reviews.title: Best boots I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Best boots I have ever owned. Felt great first time wearing and every time since. I will probably buy a back up pair because it will be my luck that they stop making them. So glad I found these.
customer_reviews.author: Julian S.

customer_reviews.title: A little snug
customer_reviews.text: They are nice and I hope they will be the right size. I feel KEEN sizing is always small and even with that these are snug. I have 3 other pairs of KEEN shoes.
customer_reviews.author: kevin

customer_reviews.title: Keen is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: We have enjoyed the keen line for boots. I buys these for both of my boys. They fit great and offer space to grow. As expected the quality was great and these boots looked really nice in brown.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Argueta

customer_reviews.title: Great Boots
customer_reviews.text: Warm, waterproof, sturdy, confidence inspiring and comfortable. Definitely another solid Keen product
customer_reviews.author: Travis Davidson

customer_reviews.title: Dumb idea! I've gone back to Keens and they ...
customer_reviews.text: when my last Keen boots finally wore out I got talked into buying a cheaper brand at the shoe store. Dumb idea! I've gone back to Keens and they feel great.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Friesen

product_meta.title: KEEN Men's Revel III Hiking Boot
product_meta.description: Revel iii winter hiking boots mean neither rain nor snow will keep you from your appointed anything. The whatever-the-weather nubuck leather is all-terrain durable and lined with the keen. Dry waterproof, breathable membrane. Two types of insulation– KEEN.
feature_bullets: Made in the USA and Imported
Fit Tip-This style is running a half size small. Suggest ordering a half size larger than usual size
